InputCSV.py.text_7:
Helppage:: Syntax: input -t topic -d date -l location -i info -va value
Command, to create a entry in our database (CSV). A entry BESTEHT AUS a topic, a date, a location, an information and a value. Do you use the command for your first time, beginn with the guided-mode.
* -h, --help, ? shows helppage, optional * -g, --guided starts the guided-mode, optional -t, --topic the topic, to order the entry, is not optional -d, --date the day of the transaction, please use the syntax JJJJMMDD, is not optional -l, --location the location, of the transaction, is not optional -i, --info some info about the transaction, is not optional -va, --value the value about the transaction, please use the syntax 0.00 (dot-notation), is not optional

InputCSV.py.text_10: Please specify a object behind the location flag.
InputCSV.py.text_11: Please specify a object behind the info flag.
InputCSV.py.text_12: Please use for the value only numbers and the dot-notation.

OutputCSV.py.text_9:
Helppage:: Syntax: output -d date [-t topic]
Command, to create a balance-calculation. Your balance will calculated by the entries of your database (CSV). Please specific a timeperiod for your calculation, based by the syntax. You can also filter you balance on your topics, but that is optional, not nessesary. For that, specific a topic for your cal- culation. Do you use the command for your first time, beginn with the guided-mode.
* -h, --help, ? shows helppage, optional * -g, --guided starts the guided-mode, optional -d, --date the timeperiod of the balance-calculation please use on of the following syntax - for a Year-Balance, use JJJJ - for a Month-Balance, use JJJJMM - for a Day-Balance, use JJJJMMDD is not optional * -t, --topic the topic, where based the calculation, optional

Topic.py.text_9:
Helppage:: Syntax: mktopic -t topic -p pole
Command, to create a new topic. A topic needs a name and a pole. The pol decided if the topic have a positiv or a negativ value. Do you use the command for your first time, beginn with the guided-mode.
* -h, --help, ? shows helppage, optional * -g, --guided starts the guided-mode, optional -n, --name the topic, to order the entry, is not optional -p, --pole the pole, decided if the entry of the topic positiv or negativ for the wallet you use "+" for positiv or "-" for negative is not optional
